Description

About Genesis

Genesis is a global leader in institutional digital asset markets. We provide a single point of access for digital asset trading, derivatives, borrowing, lending, custody and prime brokerage services.

Genesis facilitates billions in trades, loans and transactions on a monthly basis. We have a proven track record driving results for some of the largest digital asset-focused hedge funds, quant funds, family offices, VC’s, market makers and exchanges.


Join Our Team

Genesis is expanding to solve some of the toughest challenges in digital asset financial markets.


About This Role – Associate – Enterprise Risk Management

The Associate for Enterprise Risk Management (“ERM”), part of Genesis Enterprise Risk Management program, will be responsible for the oversight and execution of ERM processes and reports to the VP, Enterprise and Business Risk.

ERM identifies, measures, monitors and reports risks and exposures across Genesis through the Enterprise Risk Management Framework in relation to enterprise risk assessments, risk event analysis, scenario analysis, key risk indicators and risk reporting processes. The Associate ERM will help implement the Enterprise Risk Management Framework across Genesis, policies, procedures, processes and controls including the ERM processes. The candidate should have a strong background in the financial industry, and a deep understanding of Enterprise Risk, and Operational Risk best practice, processes, and risk related methodologies.


Responsibilities:

  • Lead and execute the Enterprise Risk Assessment engagement while aligning to the risk and control universe and regulatory requirements and expectations
  • Collaborate on the enhancement and maintenance of ERM program methodologies, polices, and procedure, including the development of new program activities
  • Maintain risk inventories (risk assessment, risk event, scenario analysis, key risk indicator), taxonomies and other elements supporting risk identification and assessment
  • Provide effective challenge on risk assessment results and communicate results to senior management
  • Collaborate with Compliance, Internal Audit, Security and Legal, including front line offices to ensure that ERM contributes to enhancing overall risk management across the organization
  • Apply Genesis’ risk taxonomy to the business operating environment to determine impact and likelihood of an event occurring as well as the control environment and residual risk
  • Identify emerging risks and recommend treatment strategies to business units and senior management
  • Help aggregate and review risk events and their monitoring and management plans
  • Identify key risk indicators and help monitor and manage organizational KRIs
  • Work closely across Genesis departments and jurisdictions to execute risk processes while aligning Genesis processes, risks and controls to regulatory requirements and expectations
  • Apply Genesis risk appetites, risk tolerances and risk taxonomy to the operating environment
  • Escalate unresolved issues impacting Genesis business to management including recommendation to pursue remediation where appropriate
  • Ensure transparency within Genesis by developing standardized report and templates to inform management on risk and performance
  • Review and update Enterprise Risk policies, procedures, processes and controls including strategies, standards tools and methodologies to measure and monitor and report on risks
  • Create and generate reports for various stakeholder
  • Assist with audit and regulatory examinations as needed

Technical Skills:

  • Advanced in Microsoft suite, including PowerPoint and Excel
  • Experience with Operational Risk tools and risk management solutions
  • Experience with GRC systems and tools (LogicGate)
  • Experience with data analytics, and data visualizations tools (a plus)

Requirements

  • Undergraduate degree in Finance, Business or other related area
  • 3-5 years of experience in Enterprise Risk Management, Operational Risk Management, Operations, Compliance, Auditing, Consulting or equivalent
  • 2+ years of direct work experience in Enterprise Risk, Operational Risk Management, or financial services industries
  • Expertise and knowledge of regulatory requirements regarding Enterprise and Operational Risk Management for Financial Institutions, including experience working with regulators (SEC, FINRA, FCA, MAS)
  • Knowledge of Broker Dealers, Financial Holding Companies, Exchanges, and other types of financial institutions
  • Knowledge of Best Practice across organizational departments (e.g. COSO, FFIEC, ISO, NIST, COBIT, etc)


Personal Attributes:

  • A high degree of integrity, professionalism, and capacity to excel in a cohesive team environment
  • Detailed oriented with the ability to multitask and quickly adapt to changing ne eds and demands
  • Excels at analysis, problem solving and strategic alignment
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communications skills
  • Ability to communicate effectively to all levels of the organization, including senior management

Benefits

  • Comprehensive health, vision, dental and FSA benefits
  • Flexible time off


Why Genesis

Genesis is dedicated to creating best-in-class infrastructure for institutional investors, developing advanced products that lower barriers, increase profitability and broaden access. Our team has decades of experience at top Wall Street investment banks and Silicon Valley technology firms, and includes leading experts in blockchain, distributed computing, cryptography and cybersecurity.

Digital Asset Ecosystem

Genesis operates at the heart of the digital asset ecosystem:

→ We are a subsidiary of Digital Currency Group (DCG), the largest investor in the bitcoin and blockchain space.

→ We have an unparalleled global network at the intersection of data, finance and technology.

Accelerating Momentum

Our addressable market is expanding rapidly as new institutional investors enter the space. Recent results include:

→ 300%+ Y/Y trading volume growth

→ 400%+ Y/Y loan origination growth

Diversity And Inclusion

About Uphold

 

One of the fastest-growing fintech companies, Uphold is pursuing a mission to democratise investments and payments for people and companies worldwide. A bridge between old and new money systems, Uphold allows people to buy, exchange and send more than 100 cryptocurrencies, precious metals, equities, and currencies instantly. Our mission is to create trusted access to digital money and financial services for the many. Since inception, we have fought to provide a fairer, easier and more affordable system. We put security and transparency first.

At Uphold, we are looking for people with passion, initiative, and integrity. We encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't 100% match the job description. We welcome diverse perspectives and people who aren't afraid to challenge the status quo. If you’re a rock star and this sounds interesting and challenging, we want to hear from you. 

 

The opportunity: 

 

Uphold is seeking an experienced and highly motivated individual to join our Compliance Team as a Financial Intelligence Unit Quality Assurance Specialist. The Financial Intelligence Unit Quality Assurance Specialist will be responsible for analyzing transaction monitoring alert dispositions, case reviews and SAR filings conducted by Uphold’s investigators, ensuring quality and sufficient rationale are evident in each scenario. The ideal candidate has experience with quality assurance in the FinTech compliance sector and is adept at managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, heavily regulated environment. This position requires an experienced candidate able to communicate effectively with internal personnel as well as our partner vendors. The Financial Intelligence Unit Quality Assurance Specialist will also perform audits as assigned, and participate in special projects as required. 

 

What you’ll be doing primarily:

 

  • Ensuring internal FIU process and quality standards are being followed correctly by internal personnel and outsourced partners by auditing a sample of cases and documenting evidence


  • Conducting QA reviews of all FIU functions including but not limited to investigations, transaction monitoring, and SAR filings where applicable 


  • Proactively identifying ways to improve quality by recommending processes and implementing changes as needed


  • Consistent reporting of quality assurance findings across all compliance functions to senior management


  • Acting as a point of contact to outsourced partners to clarify any procedural questions


  • Promoting quality awareness and implications amongst all employees by providing training and subject matter expertise


  • Analyzing data to identify improvement opportunities and create plans to achieve higher performance


  • Assisting the Compliance Team with ad-hoc projects and reviews as needed


  • Other duties as required or assigned

 

Required qualifications:

 

  • Bachelor's degree preferred, or professional license/certificate
  • 6+ years of prior transaction monitoring & surveillance investigations experience in anti-money laundering (AML), counter-terrorism, anti-bribery, and/or anti-fraud experience
  • 2+ years or more in a compliance quality assurance experience or equivalent role
  • Knowledge of and experience working with compliance-related functions at a bank, broker-dealer, or a FinTech firm

  • Experience in quality management techniques, procedures, principles, testing and evaluation methodologies 
  • Demonstrated experience in preparing case and SAR narratives, summarizing red flags, suspicious activity, and adverse information
  • Extraordinary attention to detail and strong analytical skills
  • Must be able to act independently and be self-motivated
  • Effective usage of Google Workspace and broader computer skills are required

 

Bonus if you have:

 

  • Fluency in cryptocurrencies , and risks associated with various digital assets
  • Working knowledge of and familiarity with Chainalysis, Elliptic, Unit21, or similar crypto monitoring platforms
  • Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours
  • Strong quality, delivery and customer service orientation

 

What we have to offer you:

 

  • A fun and collaborative work environment in a company that continues to grow, driven by extraordinary and passionate people that keep us innovating and challenging each day
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • An international team in a cutting edge field
  • A flexible and enthusiastic environment with work from home opportunities
  • Growth and career opportunities and the chance to be proactive and creative
  • Open and transparent culture - we get together on a regular basis to share updates, strategic plans, and engage with each other informally over (virtual) drinks
  • Interesting events that keep you connected with the team and celebrate our success

 

If this job isn’t exactly what you are looking for, visit our careers page to check out all our exciting opportunities.

job.title: Data Engineer
job.description:
As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.

The company has offices in London, UK, New York City, Singapore and Tokyo. We are backed by Evolution Equity Partners, SoftBank, SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group.

To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.

What’s the role?

Elliptic is looking for a Data Engineer to join our product-engineering organisation who can help drive forward our support for new blockchains.

We want a Data Engineer who will work collaboratively with the data science team to create and support a data lake that will improve our understanding of new blockchains and bring additional asset support to our market leading compliance products. There are thousands of potential blockchains we could add support for, with varying levels of functional complexity, a vast array of features and extensive data sets, so your role will be to help build a simplified and agnostic solution.

We are looking for somebody who always tackles the biggest risk first, who brings new ideas and approaches to development, who makes decisions with data, and who loves solving customer-centric problems.

What will you do?

  • Take pleasure from clean code and sees writing tests as core to software engineering
  • Use data to make decisions about what to build and how to iterate
  • Measures their success with usage data rather than release milestones
  • Is not afraid to fail, experiment often and learn quickly
  • Is keen to learn new technologies and challenge existing tools, methodologies, processes
  • Ship code to production every day

In a typical week you will:

  • Work in a fast, lean, agile environment with minimal process overheads
  • Develop datasets with 0ver 10 billion items
  • Use functional programming techniques to write application code
  • Collaborate with teams across product-engineering and beyond
  • Review the code of your peers, and test that it works
  • Participate in various “chapter” debates about new ideas and interesting tech
  • Support your software on production
  • STEM degree from a leading university
  • Interest in data intensive applications
  • Understanding of the Big Data ecosystem
  • Background in either Scala, Python, Java, Node.js or Typescript
  • Someone with the desire to learn and code in Scala

Bonus Points for:

  • Interest in functional programming
  • Confident working with SQL
  • Geeks out over numbers
  • HODLs some crypto
  • Share Options
  • Holiday - 25 days + public holidays
  • Enjoy your birthday off work
  • Private Health Insurance - we use Vitality!
  • Work Pension Scheme
  • Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite
  • $1000 Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription
  • £500 Home office allowance
  • Enhanced parental leave; we provide eligible employees, regardless of gender or whether they become a parent by birth or adoption, 16 weeks fully-paid leave and job-protected leave
  • Full access to Spill Mental Health Support
  • Our offices provide all of the amenities you could need
  • Work with top of the range equipment - MacBook Pro and any other equipment you need

We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
